content.description:
Very nice climbing, good landing, and a beautiful easily accessed face. Very low water levels needed.

 To the right side of the main face look for the large, high chunk. Below that find the iron band with the small pocket and the flat crimp to the right of that. Stand start with those holds.

 Climb through a higher crimp, the huge chunk, and the high top lip to top out.
Stand start at the leftmost side of the main face at the big in-set ledge. Follow up and left along jugs to the high ear at the lip. Top out.

A really nice boulder problem. When you see it, you know its a bad bench. Low water levels required.

 Stand start to the left of Main Bench in two nice underclings. Work up and slightly left toward diminishing, slopey holds. Shoot to the nice top to mantle.

Standstart midface, right hand in the small, thin crimp/pocket, left hand in a low undercling. Move into the two thin edges at the bottom of the bulge. Pounce to the blind knob/ear over the bulge. Follow the crimps to a big move to the lip and top out.

When at the bench just before you reach the Casablanca Boulders you will clearly see two big boulders in the river close to the trail. The closest one is Main Bench, the one just beyond it is Side Bench.

 During high water these are completely unclimbable, with sometimes half of the holds underwater. During normal river flow, some serious effort would need to go into building water landings. Only during low water stages or drought can these be climbed easily.

 Main Bench has a gorgeous inside face with a handful of very fun, easy to moderate, exciting problems to explore. A few pads to protect the rocky landing are needed.
